Two Canadian Poets - A Lecture signed Archibald Lampman with note Delivered on the evening of the 19th Feby 1891 at the Library of the Literary and Scientific Society, Ottawa. The above lecture was concluded with a reading of two of Cameron's most spirited poems The week of Wendall Philips and The Way of the World.

[Illegible] long unpub. p. begins O ashen faces of kings! The world with your death knell rings How Long have you looked with your cruel eyes On your brother's tears and his cries How long with your bitter breath For justice given him death A galley chain and a cord A tomb for the living dead Hunger & toil at your word & his children a slave for bread How long have fasted & slept In your silken chambers of case while the people labored & wept & their little ones died at their knees Out of the dark the change is calling Golden thrones of kings are falling [Illegible]
Why so coldly so damnably/Never look, nor speak/Dearest you can trust surely For my pain is meek
Overmuch I love & fear you/To be madly from Just to see you, just to hear you/ Is enough for me,

Dollard des Ormeaux Set out on the 19 Apr 1660 - Have a brush with the savages apparently at the Isle St Paul,lose 3 men & retire to Montreal to recover-Starting again they reach Long Saul 1st May & place themselves in a deserted fort of palings - Found by a band of Hurons & [Illegible] - Attack the vanguard of the enemy-Overpowered by the Iriquoise, retire into the fort leaving their kettles & things behind them. The Iriquois throw up an encampment opposite them after an unsuccessful attempt at parley & then attack the palisade, which has been strengthened by the French with branches, earth & stones - Iriquois are repeatedly repulsed, break up their canoes & use them as torches attempt to fire the palisade but without effect - They send for their friends at the Isles of the Richelieu - Besieged, suffer from thirst and make sorties to the river - Hurons & Algonquins desert - Iriquois reinforcements arrive and the combined host attack the fort for 3 dys in vain - Then they fire torches upon the palings - Hold a consultation - Try to parley with the French, their envoys fired upon & slain - a part of them on the 8th day propose to give up the attack but are shamed out of it by the rest, who plan a forward attack, after again questioning the deserters - Final attack- storm the palings - fatal attempt to discharge the mousqueton - Iriquois break in - Dollard falls. They open the gate & unable to make prisoners slay the rest - finding 4 yet alive cast three into the fire & reserve 1 who can be beaten(?) for torture traded?
